alert.note: Alert for Dorado; Toa Alta; Toa Baja; Vega Alta; Vega Baja (Puerto Rico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 06 at 11:54PM AST by NWS San Juan
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 AM AST MONDAY... * WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall will worsen. * WHERE...A portion of Puerto Rico, including the following , Dorado, Toa Alta, Toa Baja, Vega Alta and Vega Baja. * WHEN...Until 545 AM AST. * IMPACTS...Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. It will take many hours for all the water from these storms to work through local drainage systems in urban and upstream areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1149 PM AST, gauge reports indicated rising rivers. Flooding is already occurring in the warned area. Up to one half inch of rain has fallen in the last several hours. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Rio Cibuco Watershed, Rio de la Plata and Rio de la Plata_Coastal Drainage Watersheds. - For RIO DE LA PLATA at RIO DE LA PLATA AT HWY 2 TOA ALTA: At 11:30pm the stage was 16.79 feet. Flood Stage is 16.0 feet. ... For RIO CIBUCO at RIO CIBUCO AT VEGA BAJA: At 11:36pm the stage was 14.58 feet. Flood Stage is 15.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

area.areaDesc: Dorado; Toa Alta; Toa Baja; Vega Alta; Vega Baja
